definition: knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
(lit.) the soft knife/(fig.) underhanded tactics/devious means of attack
lit. knife mouth but heart of bean curd; sharp tongue concealing a caring heart
pinyin: dao1 zi5 zui3 ba5 , dou4 fu5 xin1

definition: to have a sharp tongue but a soft heart (idiom)
pinyin: dao1 zi5 zui3 , dou4 fu5 xin1

definition: lit. knives rain down from the sky (idiom)/fig. (even if) the sky crumbles

sentences.english: Wear resistance of cake cutting knives using a special abrasion-proof material.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕切口刀子耐磨性使用特別磨蝕證明材料。

sentences.english: You get a gimmicked knife and a regular knife.
sentences.chinese: 此道具包括一個帶機關的刀和一個普通的刀子。
她言語尖刻，有一張刀子般的嘴。

sentences.english: Then he took up the oar with the knife lashed to it.
sentences.chinese: 然後他拿起上面綁着刀子的槳。

sentences.english: That done, he put the knife back in the drawer and shut it.
sentences.chinese: 試過以後，又把那刀子放進抽屜，重行推上。

sentences.english: The hunter who wants a good all-around knife should consider the clip point blade.
sentences.chinese: 如果獵人需要一把全能型的刀子的話可以考慮。

sentences.english: This knife is used to peel the fruit.
sentences.chinese: 這把刀子被用來削水果。

sentences.english: They always negotiate while holding a sword behind their back.
sentences.chinese: 他們總是一邊談判，一邊在你背後捅刀子。

sentences.english: The knife was stuck but she pulled it out with a jerk.
sentences.chinese: 刀子被卡住了，她猛地一拔，把它拔了出來。

sentences.english: He struck sparks from the stone with his knife.
sentences.chinese: 他用刀子在石頭上砍出火花。

sentences.english: Esmeralda 's knife and Djali's horns were still pointing at Gringoire.
sentences.chinese: 愛斯梅拉達的刀子和賈利的羊角仍在對着格蘭瓜爾。

sentences.english: As far as I know, knives don't appear on the dining-table in Asian countries as a rule.
sentences.chinese: 據我所瞭解，在亞洲各國刀子一般不在餐桌上出現。

sentences.english: China is such a backstabbing nation anyway.
sentences.chinese: 總之中國是一個背後捅刀子的國家。
馬基雅維利給了他一把刀子。

sentences.english: That day, Big Xu stuck his knife in the door sill for a moment while he did something else.
sentences.chinese: 那天，大許忙此外事時，隨手把他的刀子插在門檻上。

sentences.english: A blunt knife draws no blood.
sentences.chinese: 鈍刀子割肉割不出血來。

definition: to stab/to poke/to prod/to nudge/to disclose
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
(lit.) the soft knife/(fig.) underhanded tactics/devious means of attack
